sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the use of a desiccator to maintain a moisture-free environment.
sections.scope: Applicable to sample preservation in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Check that the desiccant (silica gel) is dry (indicated by blue color).
Apply a thin layer of vacuum grease to the ground-glass flange.
Place the sample (usually in an open crucible or boat) on the perforated plate.
Slide the lid onto the base to create an airtight seal.
Allow the sample to reach equilibrium in the dry environment.
When removing a sample, slide the lid off carefully to avoid disturbing the contents.
Regenerate the silica gel in an oven if it turns pink.
Keep the desiccator in a cool, dry place.
precautions: Do not place very hot items directly into the desiccator; allow them to cool slightly first.
Handle the heavy glass lid with care to avoid dropping or cracking.
Ensure the flange is kept clean and properly greased.
Do not lift the desiccator by the lid; always hold the base.
Keep the desiccator closed at all times when not loading/unloading.
